Name: Christopher Ananian
Additional Information:
Dr. Ananian completed a fellowship in Breast/Body Imaging at Yale 
 New Haven Hospital. His education includes a B.A. in Biology and B.S. in Exercise Science from The State University of Rutgers (2000), and an M.D. from UMDNJ New Jersey Medical School (2004). He completed an internship at Graduate Hospital in Philadelphia, Pennsylvania, and a Diagnostic Imaging Residency at Hospital of Saint Raphael in New Haven, Connecticut (2009). He is board-certified by the American Board of Radiology. Hospital affiliations include Penn Medicine Princeton Medical Center. Professional memberships include the Radiology Society of North America, American College of Radiology, and American Medical Association. He serves as co-chair on the executive committee for breast imaging for the Radiological Society of New Jersey. Dr. Ananian is known for his compassionate patient interaction during breast imaging examinations and has spoken at the Susan G. Komen Central and South Jersey Virtual IMPACT Luncheon on women's breast health, breast density, and screening. He performs Molecular Breast Imaging, Breast Cancer Screening, Mammograms, Breast Biopsy, and treats conditions such as Menopause, Low Bone Density, and Breast Cancer. He is also associated with University Radiology, Hillsborough Radiology, and CentraState Healthcare System.

Name: William Wong

Name: Vivek Padha
Additional Information:
Dr. Vivek Padha completed his radiology residency and interventional radiology fellowship at Yale New Haven Hospital (residency 2008, Chief Resident 2009, fellowship 2010). He holds an MD from Government Medical College 
 Jammu, India (1995) or Mumbai University / Bombay Hospital Institute of Medical Sciences (1995), and completed an internship and residency in Family Medicine at Prince Georges Hospital Center (1998) and University of Illinois at Chicago Medical College (2000) respectively. He is board-certified by the American Board of Radiology in Interventional Radiology & Diagnostic Radiology (certified 2018). Dr. Padha is a Colonel in the U.S. Army Reserve and serves as the Radiology Consultant to the Surgeon General of the U.S. Army, leading the medical specialty of radiology for the entire Reserve division. He was honored with the prestigious Fellowship of the Society of Interventional Radiology (FSIR) and has received 4 hospital awards. He has over 30 years of clinical experience and serves on the boards of several elite institutions, including the American Board of Radiology. His clinical focus is on minimally-invasive techniques for various diseases, performing procedures such as Non-Coronary Angioplasty, Atherectomy, Stenting, Embolectomy, Thrombectomy, Vessel Exploration, Molecular Breast Imaging, Breast Cancer Screening, Paracentesis, Abdominal Ultrasound, CT Scan, Mammogram, and Ultrasound-Guided Breast Biopsy. His top areas of expertise include Ascites, Visceromegaly, Varicose Veins, Bone Marrow Aspiration, and Gastrostomy. He is an Assistant Professor in the Department of Radiology at West Virginia University Eastern Campus and co-authored a peer-reviewed article on "Interventional Radiology Workforce Shortages Affecting Small and Rural Practices".
